entries.title: Israeli loudspeakers broadcast Netanyahu's speech to UN into Gaza
entries.snippet:
In an unusual and controversial move, the Israeli military used loudspeakers mounted on trucks near the Gaza border to broadcast Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's speech to the UN General Assembly into Gaza. This action, coordinated by Netanyahu's office and the Israel Defense Forces (IDF), aimed to deliver a direct message to Gaza's residents, stating that war would end if Hamas disarmed and hostages were returned. Netanyahu warned that those who cooperate would live, whereas others would be pursued.

Claims were also made that Israel accessed Gaza residents' phones to transmit the speech, but no evidence confirmed this on the ground. The operation, particularly the deployment of soldiers and loudspeakers inside or near Gaza, sparked backlash in Israel, with military officers criticizing it as strategically pointless.

Netanyahu’s address at the UN condemned international support for Palestinian statehood and reaffirmed Israel's commitment to continuing its offensive in Gaza, which has already resulted in over 65,000 Palestinian deaths and widespread devastation. As famine grips parts of Gaza, civilians continue to suffer amid heavy bombardments and destruction.

entries.title: Netanyahu says backing Palestinian state sends message: Murdering Jews pays off
entries.snippet:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu strongly criticized Western nations for recognizing Palestinian statehood, accusing them of rewarding Hamas for its October 7, 2023 attack that killed around 1,200 people in Israel. Speaking at the U.N. General Assembly, Netanyahu condemned recent diplomatic moves by countries like France, Britain, Australia, and Canada, which he said send the message that “murdering Jews pays off.” He rejected accusations of genocide and war crimes amid global outrage over Israel's military response in Gaza, which has reportedly killed over 65,000 people and devastated the territory.

Netanyahu emphasized that his government will not permit the creation of a Palestinian state, amidst increasing international isolation and domestic pressure over the ongoing war. He reaffirmed Israel’s goal to fully dismantle Hamas and expressed support for efforts to rescue the remaining hostages held in Gaza. His speech was met with mixed reactions at the U.N., with walkouts and applause. Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas, banned from attending in person, thanked countries recognizing Palestine and pledged to govern Gaza post-war. Meanwhile, U.S. President Donald Trump stated he would oppose Israeli annexation of the West Bank, aiming to protect previous peace efforts like the Abraham Accords.

entries.title: Delegater lämnade rummet när Netanyahu talade
entries.snippet:
Vid ett tal inför FN:s generalförsamling lämnade flera delegater salen i protest när Israels premiärminister Benjamin Netanyahu tog till orda. Samtidigt mottogs han av jubel från andra. I sitt tal hävdade Netanyahu att Israel har besegrat huvuddelen av Hamas "terrormaskin" och tackade USA:s tidigare president Donald Trump för hans stöd. Han läste upp namn på kvarvarande gisslan och uppgav att talet sändes direkt till högtalare och telefoner i Gazaremsan, riktat direkt till de tillfångatagna.

Netanyahu kritiserade också de länder som riktar sanktioner mot Israel eller fördömer dess agerande i Gaza. Han förnekade att Israel skulle utsätta civilbefolkningen för svält eller begå folkmord. Händelsen har gett upphov till starka reaktioner, både av stöd och protest, och rapporteras av flera stora internationella medier.

entries.snippet:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu strongly criticized Western nations for recognizing Palestinian statehood, accusing them of rewarding Hamas for its October 7, 2023 attack that killed around 1,200 people in Israel. Speaking at the U.N. General Assembly, Netanyahu condemned recent diplomatic moves by countries like France, Britain, Australia, and Canada, which he said send the message that “murdering Jews pays off.” He rejected accusations of genocide and war crimes amid global outrage over Israel's military response in Gaza, which has reportedly killed over 65,000 people and devastated the territory.

entries.title: Mass walkouts as Netanyahu addresses UN general assembly
entries.snippet:
During a contentious address to the United Nations General Assembly on September 26, 2025, Israeli Prime Minister Binyamin Netanyahu faced widespread walkouts and protests from delegates, particularly near the Iranian desk. In an emotionally charged speech aimed at both the international community and hostages held in Gaza, Netanyahu used symbolic gestures, including wearing a QR-code badge to explain Israel’s war efforts, and claimed his speech was being broadcast through loudspeakers surrounding Gaza and into citizens' phones.

He emphasized Israel’s military actions as self-defense in what he called a “seven-front war” against regional enemies, citing recent strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities and operations against Hezbollah, the Houthis, and Iran-backed militias. Netanyahu urged Hamas to release hostages, promising their safety in return, while threatening continued military pursuit otherwise. He also denied accusations of causing starvation in Gaza, blaming Hamas for intercepting humanitarian aid.

The speech was delayed due to disruptions, which included jeering and applause. Meanwhile, U.S. President Trump hinted at a pending deal that could return hostages and end the war, calling it a potential landmark achievement in his peace initiatives.

parts:
Here are reliable places to watch the **full video** of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s address to the UN General Assembly (UNGA 80) on **26 Sep 2025**:

1) **PBS NewsHour — full player (Day 4, UNGA 2025)**  
Live page with full replay; scrub to Netanyahu’s slot. citeturn0search5

2) **YouTube live recordings of the address**  
Multiple networks streamed the speech; these pages typically retain the full replay:  
• PBS NewsHour YouTube live: “WATCH LIVE: Israel’s Benjamin Netanyahu addresses U.N. General Assembly.” citeturn1search1  
• Additional live recording (major broadcasters’ feed). citeturn1search9turn0search3

3) **UN Web TV (official recording)**  
The UN’s official archive posts the **individual speaker video** for each address; use the UN Web TV schedule/General Debate hub and select **Israel — General Debate, 80th Session** once the asset is listed. citeturn1search19

If you want, I can also timestamp the exact start/end of Netanyahu’s segment from the PBS player so you can jump straight to it.
